communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA - Michael A. Taylor Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

An electronic copy of the bodycam footage regarding the Michael A. Taylor incident that occurred on October 22, 2024 after a traffic stop at the Dollar General located at 914 Sheridan Rd, Winthrop Harbor, IL 60096. Taylor was arrested on the charges of bribery, aggravated battery to a peace officer and resisting a peace officer causing injury.

Specifically, I am seeking to obtain electronic copies of the:

1. BWC footage recorded by Winthrop Harbor Police Department's responding officers (main officer and assisting) detailing their full involvement in this incident

To assist you in locating the footage here are the key details of the incident:
Date of Event: October 22, 2024
Names: Michael A. Taylor
Location of Event: 914 Sheridan Rd, Winthrop Harbor, IL 60096

Please let me know if you require further information to process it.

If any aspects of this request are denied, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and please notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Johnson

title: Any usage of FTI for AI disclosures sent to the Office of Safeguards 4/14-Present

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Any usage of FTI for AI disclosures sent to the Office of Safeguards 4/14-Present
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any emails, memorandum, or other documentation sent to the Office of Safeguards re: the usage of FTI for Artificial Intelligence (AI) purposes by ICE between the dates of 4/14/2025 to present/

Records Source: The MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN U.S. TREASURY DEPARTMENT on behalf of the INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AND U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY on behalf of the U.S. IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT, FOR THE EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION FOR NONTAX CRIMINAL ENFORCEMENT requires the "Usage of FTI for Artificial Intelligence (AI) purposes must be disclosed to the Office of Safeguards for assessment of compliance with safeguard requirements."* 

Time Period: I am requesting any documentation sent in the last two weeks to keep this request narrow and timely. 

Expedited Processing: I request  expedited processing of this request because there is an urgent compelling need to inform the public of the policies and decision-making regarding the ICE analysis of FTI for immigration policy implementation. Politicians on both sides of the aisle have also called attention to excessive use of sensitive data by this administration. For example, on April 9, 18 Senators wrote to the Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration (TIGTA) investingdation access to ICE access of taxpayer information.**

* Source: https://files.epi.org/uploads/IRS_ICE_MOU-April-2025.pdf
** Source: https://www.taxnotes.com/research/federal/legislative-documents/congressional-tax-correspondence/senators-seek-investigation-ice-access-taxpayer-info/7rys7

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: TSA Biometric Pilot Records – JFK (Expedited Request)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

created between March 1, 2025 and August 30, 2025 related to TSA biometric pilots at John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK):

(1) Internal evaluation or pilot assessment reports prepared by TSA program offices (e.g., Requirements & Capabilities Analysis or CAT Program Office) that summarize performance, risks, or “lessons learned” from biometric deployments at JFK (Touchless ID, CAT-2, or eGates).

(2) Agreements with private vendors (such as CLEAR, IDEMIA, or similar) governing biometric deployments at JFK during this timeframe, including MOUs, pilot participation agreements, or Other Transaction Agreements (OTAs).

I request expedited processing under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) and 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e), as there is an urgent need to inform the public about TSA’s expansion of biometric surveillance at one of the nation’s busiest airports. Millions of travelers are affected, and timely disclosure is essential for public oversight and debate.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the Manchester Police Department’s Flock Safety system, specifically:

CONTRACTS and AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Flock Safety that were active any time between 1/1/2025 and to the date this request is processed.  This includes documentation related to the acquisition, leasing, or use of Flock Safety cameras or services, including data platforms or analytics tools.

GUIDING DOCUMENTATION and POLICIES
• All policies, memorandums of understanding, and other guidance materials generated by this agency and/or entity operating on its behalf regarding the acquisition and use of any data or services provided by Flock Safety and any representative thereof or any subdivision thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, any data-sharing agreements,  training materials, or other guidance materials.
• This should also include, but is not limited to, policies, records, or data related to sharing of passwords or access with local, regional, or federal task forces or agents.

USAGE DATA
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of 1/1/2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of 1/1/2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide any documents in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide PDF, CSV, or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Request for Public Records – White Stadium Public Records Requests and Responses

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Request for Public Records – White Stadium Public Records Requests and Responses
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, I request the following records:

⸻

1. Boston Globe Request on White Stadium Cost Projections
	•	A complete copy of the public records request(s) submitted by the Boston Globe regarding White Stadium cost projections (referenced in the Globe’s coverage dated August 28, 2025).
	•	A complete copy of the City of Boston’s responses to that request, including correspondence, denial letters, or extensions issued by your office or other City departments.
	•	Any internal tracking logs, request IDs, or reference numbers assigned by the City to the Globe’s White Stadium request(s).

⸻

2. All Other White Stadium–Related Public Records Requests
	•	Copies of all other public records requests submitted to the City of Boston since January 1, 2020 concerning White Stadium, including but not limited to requests about:
	•	Cost estimates, financial projections, or budgets;
	•	Contracts, bids, procurement, or vendor solicitations;
	•	Public-private partnership agreements or memoranda of understanding;
	•	Community engagement, public comment, or meeting records;
	•	Any related correspondence.
	•	Copies of all responses issued by the City (whether granting, partially fulfilling, or denying such requests).
	•	Copies of all materials released by the City in response to the above requests.
	•	Any internal tracking logs, request IDs, or reference numbers associated with White Stadium–related requests in the City’s Public Records Center or other systems.

⸻

Standard Verification and Format Instructions
	•	If no responsive records exist for a given item, please confirm that no such records exist.
	•	Please identify the custodians and systems searched, and describe the methods used to locate responsive records.
	•	If responsive records include databases, spreadsheets, or summary logs, please provide them in a machine-readable format (e.g., .csv or Excel).
	•	Please include any available metadata showing dates of record creation, sender, and recipient, where applicable.
	•	If responsive records exist in draft or revised form, please include those versions as well.
	•	Please include any policies, notices, or instructions to staff regarding the handling, retention, deletion, or suppression of White Stadium–related requests or records.

⸻

I request that records be provided in electronic format via email. If there are any fees for fulfilling this request, please provide a detailed written estimate in advance as required by law.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Florida DOT Removal of Street Art

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida DOT Removal of Street Art
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The Department of Transportation issued to a statement to CNN, which reported (at https://www.cnn.com/2025/08/22/us/pulse-orlando-removal-rainbow-crosswalk-hnk):

“Last week, local governments not in compliance for local roads began receiving notifications to bring their roadways up to state standards to ensure locals govern themselves accordingly,” the department told CNN in a statement. “In addition to ensuring all local governments comply, FDOT completed a review of all state-maintained roadways and is now correcting pavement markings not in compliance. That includes street art previously installed on state right of way, such as the intersection of Orange Avenue in question.”

I request a copy of all the "notifications to bring their roadways up to state standards" with respect to "pavement markings" or "street art" as referenced by the Department's statement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
